Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Nielsen, Benoit, Mozart, Schickhard, Haydn, JS Bach and JC Bach

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe continues the programme with music from Chambonnières, Walters, Handel, Avison, Gottschalk and Stravinsky

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe ends the programme with music by Mosonyi, Liszt, Finzi, Vaughan Williams, Respighi, Nielsen, Merula, Lassus, Zulawski, Brahms, Beethoven and Ravel

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Martin Handley presents music by Mozart, Mendelssohn, Dvorák and Tippett

Content.Name: CD Review
Content.Description: Andrew McGregor plays some of this month's newest releases

Content.Name: The Early Music Show
Content.Description: The History of the Horn: Roger Montgomery describes and demonstrates the progression of the Horn from Cave to Concert Hall, taking in a Tibetan Monastery and a Swiss Alp on the way

Content.Name: Discovering Music
Content.Description: Stephen Johnson joins the BBC Philharmonic and conductor Yasuo Shinozaki in front of an invited audience to explore the mysteries of Sibelius' profound Symphony No 7

Content.Name: World Routes
Content.Description: Lucy Duran presents the second of two programmes recorded on location in Uganda

Content.Name: Jazz Line-up
Content.Description: The annual New Year round table discussion about all things Jazz

Content.Name: Jazz Record Requests
Content.Description: Geoffrey Smith requests your favourite jazz cut by E mail: jazz

Content.Name: Opera on 3
Content.Description: Live from the Met: L'Elisir d'Amore

Content.Name: The Met Opera Quiz
Content.Description: Steven Blier puts listeners' questions to Ben Cameron, Henry Fogel and Stuart Hamilton

Content.Name: Opera on 3
Content.Description: Live from the Met

Content.Name: The Verb
Content.Description: Second of two programmes in which Ian MacMillan looks back over the best writing and performances broadcast by The Verb in the past twelve months

Content.Name: Between the Ears
Content.Description: Virgins and Virginals: The Shadowy World of John Bull: A portrait of the keyboard composer within a musical frame composed by Steven Faux, featuring the saxophone of Will Gregory

Content.Name: Pre-Hear
Content.Description: As a prelude to tonight's coverage of the 2005 Huddersfield Contemporary Music Festival, a flashback to 2004 and Kevin Volan's String Quartet No 1, White Man Sleeps, played by the Smith Quartet

Content.Name: Hear and Now
Content.Description: First of five broadcasts from the Huddersfield Contemporary Music Festival

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Sibelius, Mahler, JS Bach, Spohr, Beethoven and Mozart

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe ends the programme with music by Sweelinck, Sandström, Froberger, Geminiani, Castello, Kempis, Mokranjac, Grzincic, Zarzycki, JS Bach, Ockeghem, Leo and Noskowski

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Mozart, Mendelssohn, Pergolesi and Tippett

Content.Name: The Cowan Collection
Content.Description: Rob Cowan presents music by Shigeaki Saegusa, Liszt, Scarlatti, Adams, Handel, Grieg, Massenet, Stamitz, Dukenov, Sibelius and Schutz

Content.Name: Private Passions
Content.Description: Michael Berkeley's guest is actor Prunella Scales

Content.Name: The Early Music Show
Content.Description: Catherine Bott visits Santiago de Compostela in Spain

Content.Name: Sunday Gala
Content.Description: Stephanie Hughes presents a concert given by the baritone Thomas Quasthoff with pianist Charles Spencer at the Wigmore Hall last year

Content.Name: 3 For All with Brian Kay
Content.Description: Brian Kay's selection of requests includes Britten's The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra, sacred music by Verdi, Bernstein's Chichester Psalms and Ravel's String Quartet

Content.Name: Music Matters
Content.Description: Tom Service visits the City Halls in Glasgow, which have had a massive refurbishment, updating the concert hall and becoming the new home of the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra

Content.Name: The Choir
Content.Description: Aled Jones begins his new series on choirs by celebrating one of Britain's most highly regarded choral directors, David Willcocks

Content.Name: Drama on 3
Content.Description: Black Dirt, by Nell Leyshon

Content.Name: Sunday Feature
Content.Description: Charles Correa - Finding a New Indian Architecture: David Adjaye profiles Charles Correa, the modernist architect whose work has helped forge a national identity in India

Content.Name: Andy Kershaw
Content.Description: Selections from Crouch End's finest record collection, and the debut session from dancehall/Balkan fusion band Horace X

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Mozart, Chopin, Beethoven, Berlioz, Handel, Mendelssohn, Lehar and Schumann

Content.Name: CD Masters
Content.Description: Rob Cowan features Dvorák's Slavonic Dances and Rhapsodies and recordings by Josef Schmidt

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Franz Schubert (1797-1828): 1/5

Content.Name: Lunchtime Concert
Content.Description: New Generation Artists: Verity Sharp presents the a performance by the brilliant young French pianist, Cédric Tiberghien from Wigmore Hall in London

Content.Name: Afternoon Performance
Content.Description: BBC National Orchestra of Wales: Orchestral songs performed by some of the world's leading female singers feature in this week's programmes

Content.Name: Making Tracks
Content.Description: CBBC's Angellica Bell and Adrian Dickson present the programme for younger listeners

Content.Name: Stage and Screen
Content.Description: Dance Fever: Edward Seckerson delves into the modern Broadway era of the 70s dance scene with songs from Ballroom, Steel Pier and of course, Saturday Night Fever

Content.Name: In Tune
Content.Description: Petroc Trelawny presents a selection of music and keeps us up to date with what's happening in the arts world

Content.Name: BBC Proms 2005
Content.Description: Louise Fryer presents this special series of highlights from last summer's Proms with a selection of music that continues the festival's nautical theme

Content.Name: Night Waves
Content.Description: Matthew Sweet ventures into the dark history of the forbidden experiment - the deliberate long-term isolation of children with the aim of discovering truths about human nature

Content.Name: Late Junction
Content.Description: Verity Sharp features music from the Wingdale Community Singers, Argentinian accordionist Chango Spasiuk, and French composer Marin Marais

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Aaron Copland (1900-1990): 2/5

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents a composer portrait of Carl Czerny plus music by Mendelssohn, JS Bach, Villa-Lobos and R Strauss

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Salmenhaara, Czerny, Verrijt, Saint-Saëns, Tallis, Scarlatti, Merula, Webern, Ravel, Debussy and Mozart

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Schumann, Elgar, Mozart, Chopin, Wagner, Vivaldi, Liszt and Adam

Content.Name: CD Masters
Content.Description: Rob Cowan presents music by Dvorák, Verdi, Lawes, Beethoven, Legrenzio, Gastaldon and Berlioz

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Franz Schubert (1797-1828): 2/5

Content.Name: Afternoon Performance
Content.Description: BBC Symphony Orchestra: Orchestral songs performed by some of the world's leading female singers feature in this week's programmes

Content.Name: Voices
Content.Description: Iain Burnside introduces a specially recorded recital of English songs by the baritone Roderick Williams, including George Butterworth's settings of AE Housman's A Shropshire Lad

Content.Name: BBC Proms 2005
Content.Description: Continuing this special Christmas and New Year series of highlights from last summer's Proms, Sandy Burnett presents patriotic music from both sides of the Atlantic

Content.Name: Night Waves
Content.Description: Isabel Hilton and guests explore the film adaptation of Arthur Golden's best-selling novel Memoirs of a Geisha, which has already caused controversy

Content.Name: Late Junction
Content.Description: Verity Sharp's selections include 13th-century choral music by Perotin, electronic sounds from Desmond Leslie, and Hungarian folk from Marta Sebestyen with her group Muzsikas

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Aaron Copland (1900-1990): 3/5

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents Les Boréades de Montréal performing baroque music by Boismortier

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Wilbye, Handel, Telemann, Scarlatti, Mozart, Strauss, Eyck, Gastoldi, Elgar, Butterworth, Grieg and Rachmaninov

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Mozart, Sullivan, Prokofiev, Purcell, Handel, Elgar and Wagner

Content.Name: CD Masters
Content.Description: Rob Cowan presents music by Dvorák, Smetana, Vivaldi, Halevy, Shostakovich, Tauber and Ballard

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Franz Schubert (1797-1828): 3/5

Content.Name: Afternoon Performance
Content.Description: BBC National Orchestra of Wales: Sandy Burnett presents music by Moeran, Britten and Elgar performed live from the St David's Hall, Cardiff

Content.Name: Choral Evensong
Content.Description: Live from Wakefield Cathedral

Content.Name: Night Waves
Content.Description: Director Sam Mendes talks to Philip Dodd about his latest film Jarhead

Content.Name: Late Junction
Content.Description: Verity Sharp introduces atmospheric music by Rachel and Julia Wolfe, a choral remembrance of Thomas Morley by Thomas Weelkes, and a remix of the Nine Inch Nails by Aphex Twin

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Aaron Copland (1900-1990): 4/5

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Brahms, Monteverdi, Walond, Platti, Lassus, Ghys, Kelemen, Koehne and Schmidt

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe concludes with music by Aufschnaiter, JS Bach, Handel, Noskowski, Chausson, Strauss, Dvorák, Lovelock, Rachmaninov and Mielck

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Featuring music by Mozart, Paganini, Schumann, Strauss, Thalberg, Wagner and Rachmaninov

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Franz Schubert (1797-1828): 4/5

Content.Name: Lunchtime Concert
Content.Description: Chopin Plus: Chopin has played an important part in the career of pianist Freddy Kempf, who partners his music with that of Franz Liszt

Content.Name: Afternoon Performance
Content.Description: Sandy Burnett continues to feature some of the world's leading female singers

Content.Name: Brian Kay's Light Programme
Content.Description: More from a new Montague Phillips CD with Gavin Sutherland and the BBC Concert Orchestra, plus library music by Edward White, Robert Docker and Reginald Porter-Brown

Content.Name: Opera on 3
Content.Description: Il barbiere di Siviglia: The Covent Garden production of Rossini's masterpiece, described by Verdi as the most beautiful comic opera of all

Content.Name: Interval
Content.Description: Christopher Cook talks to Royal Ballet Director, Monica Mason, about choreographer Kenneth MacMillan and one of the key works during his time with the Company, Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring

Content.Name: Opera on 3
Content.Description: The second and final Act of Rossini's Il barbiere di Siviglia

Content.Name: Night Waves
Content.Description: Turner prize-winning artist Grayson Perry talks to Philip Dodd about his autobiography, Grayson Perry: Portrait of the Artist as a Young Girl

Content.Name: Late Junction
Content.Description: Verity Sharp's selections include instrumental taarab music from Zanzibar and a fantasia by Orlando di Lasso

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Aaron Copland (1900-1990) 5/5

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Halvorsen, Svendsen, Sarasate, Elgar, Brahms, Kraus, Schütz and CPE Bach

Content.Name: Through the Night
Content.Description: Susan Sharpe presents music by Handel, Lassus, JS Bach, Schäfer, Pejacevic, Hubay, Tormis, Schubert, Pylkkänen, Stenhammar and Rózycki

Content.Name: Morning on 3
Content.Description: Martin Handley presents music by Strauss, Schumann, Walton, Mozart, Barber, Webern, Dvorak and Mozart

Content.Name: CD Masters
Content.Description: Rob Cowan presents music by May, Dvorak, Beethoven, Knauer, Dvorak, Reich and Elgar

Content.Name: Composer of the Week
Content.Description: Franz Schubert (1797-1828): 5/5: No more waltzes: Donald Macleod looks at Schubert's final year, during which life became increasingly serious for the still-young composer

Content.Name: Lunchtime Concert
Content.Description: Chopin Plus: Fiona Talkington presents former Radio 3 New Generation Artist Llyr Williams performing from LSO St Luke's in London

Content.Name: Jazz Legends
Content.Description: Another change to hear Julian Joseph in conversation with two illustrious members of the Dizzy Gillespie Alumni All-Star Big Band, electric bassist John Lee and legendary trombonist Slide Hampton

Content.Name: Performance on 3
Content.Description: Get Carter! Live from the Barbican, London: John Tusa presents The BBC SO's annual January Weekend - a celebration of the great US composer Elliott Carter

Content.Name: Twenty Minutes
Content.Description: Elliott Carter reflects on his life and work with Ivan Hewett, and explains how he has drawn on elements of both the American and European traditions in his music

Content.Name: Night Waves
Content.Description: Augusten Burroughs, author of the acclaimed memoir Running With Scissors, talks to Paul Allen about his first novel Sellevision

Content.Name: Get Carter!
Content.Description: Get Carter! The Music of Elliott Carter: Rural life, the lovelorn, and the power of music are themes explored in Elliott Carter's choral pieces and the Elizabethan madrigalists he admires

Content.Name: Jazz on 3
Content.Description: Jez Nelson interviews saxophonist Charles Lloyd and presents a concert from the London Jazz Festival featuring Lloyd with tabla player Zakir Hussain and drummer Eric Harland
